sen.j: 山東 京伝（さんとう きょうでん、宝暦11年8月15日 (旧暦)（1761年9月13日）-文化 (元号)13年9月7日 (旧暦)（1816年10月27日）は江戸時代の絵師、戯作者。
sen.e: Kyoden SANTO (September 13, 1761 - October 27, 1816) was a painter and a Gesaku (the light literature) writer who lived during the Edo Period.
Kyoden SANTO (September 13, 1761 - October 27, 1816) was a painter and a Gesaku (light literature) writer who lived during the Edo Period.
sen.cmt: "the light literature"→"the"はいらないと思います。
sen.e: Kyoden SANTO (September 13, 1761 - October 27, 1816) was a painter and a Gesaku (light literature) writer who lived during the Edo Period.
His real name was Samuru IWASE.

sen.cmt: 「京屋伝蔵」→「京屋」は名字ではないと思われるので、原文通りの語順で"Kyoya Denzo"と修正しました。
sen.e: His common name was Kyoya Denzo.

sen.j: 合巻作者の山東京山は実弟。
sen.e: Kyozan SANTO, a writer of Gokan (a long fiction book consisting of several booklets of short stories), was his younger brother.
Kyozan SANTO, a writer of Gokan (bound-together volumes of illustrated books), was his younger brother.
sen.cmt: 「合巻」→説明に「短編数冊から成る」とありますが、辞書で調べると「数冊分の長編」のようです。用語集の訳の方が良いように思います。（http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%90%88%E5%B7%BB）
sen.e: Kyozan SANTO, a writer of Gokan (bound-together volumes of illustrated books), was his younger brother.

sen.j: 寛政の改革で手鎖の処罰を受けたことで知られる。
sen.e: He is known for the punishment of a tegusari (confinement to one's residence with handcuffs on the wrists) he received during the Kansei Reforms.
He is known for the punishment of a tegusari (confinement to one's residence with handcuffs on the wrists) he received during the Kansei Reforms.
He is known for the punishment of a tegusari (confinement to one's residence with handcuffs on the wrists) he received during the Kansei Reforms.

sen.j: 江戸・深川 (江東区)の出身。
sen.e: He was born in Fukagawa, Edo (Koto Ward, Tokyo).
He was born in Fukagawa, Edo (Koto Ward, Tokyo).
He was born in Fukagawa, Edo (Koto Ward, Tokyo).

sen.j: 生家岩瀬家は木場の質屋だったという。
sen.e: It is said that the IWASE family, which he was born into, run a pawnshop in Kiba.
It is said that the Iwase family, which he was born into, ran a pawnshop in Kiba.
sen.cmt: "IWASE"→頭文字のみ大文字に修正（用語統一リスト）"run"→"ran"時制の修正
sen.e: It is said that the Iwase family, which he was born into, ran a pawnshop in Kiba.

sen.j: 浮世絵師・北尾重寅に学び、草双紙（黄表紙）の挿絵画家、北尾政寅としてデビュー。
sen.e: Kyoden studied under an Ukiyo-e artist, Shigetora KITAO, and debuted as an illustration painter for Kibyoshi bon (the illustrated book of popular tales with yellow covers in the late Edo period) under the name of Masatora KITAO.
sen.cmt: 北尾重寅、北尾政寅：読み方不明
sen.e: Kyoden studied under an Ukiyo-e artist, Shigetora KITAO, and debuted as an illustration painter for Kibyoshi (the illustrated book of popular tales with yellow covers in the late Edo period) under the name of Masanobu KITAO.
sen.cmt: 「北尾政寅」→「北尾政演（まさのぶ）」の間違いです。（http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%8C%97%E5%B0%BE%E6%94%BF%E6%BC%94）「北尾重寅」→原文・元訳通り「しげとら」のままにしていますが、山東京伝が浮世絵を学んだのは「北尾重政（しげまさ）」のようです。（http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%B1%B1%E6%9D%B1%E4%BA%AC%E4%BC%9D）web上のwikipediaには正しい名前が載っています。"Kibyoshi bon"→"bon"は原文にないので削除しました。特に補う必要もないようです。（http://kotobank.jp/word/%E9%BB%84%E8%A1%A8%E7%B4%99）
sen.e: Kyoden studied under an Ukiyo-e artist, Shigetora KITAO, and debuted as an illustration painter for Kibyoshi (the illustrated book of popular tales with yellow covers in the late Edo period) under the name of Masanobu KITAO.

sen.j: のちに戯作者に転じ、山東京伝と号した。
sen.e: He later switched over to a Gesaku writer and called himself as Kyoden SANTO.

sen.j: 黄表紙や洒落本を数多く書き、売れっ子作家となった。
sen.e: Kyoden became a popular writer by publishing numerous Kibyoshi and Sharebon (literally, witty books).
Kyoden became a popular writer by publishing numerous Kibyoshi and Sharebon (literally, witty books).

sen.j: 曲亭馬琴も京伝に入門して、戯作者として出発した。
sen.e: Bakin KYOKUTEI became his disciple and started a career as a Gesaku writer.
Bakin KYOKUTEI became his disciple and started a career as a Gesaku writer.
Bakin KYOKUTEI became his disciple and started a career as a Gesaku writer.

sen.j: 1791年（寛政3年）に出した京伝の洒落本と黄表紙が寛政の改革の出版取締りにより摘発され、手鎖50日の刑を受けた。
sen.e: Kyoden received a punishment of 50 days of a tegusari for publishing Sharebon and Kibyoshi in 1791 during the crackdown on printing matters in the Kansei Reforms.
Kyoden received a punishment of 50 days of a tegusari for his Sharebon and Kibyoshi published in 1791 during the crackdown on printing matters in the Kansei Reforms.
sen.cmt: "for publishing Sharebon and Kibyoshi"→「本を出版したことによって刑を受けた」意味になりますが、本を出版したことではなく、出版した本の内容が問題だったと思われます。修正しました。
sen.e: Kyoden received a punishment of 50 days of a tegusari for his Sharebon and Kibyoshi published in 1791 during the crackdown on printing matters in the Kansei Reforms.

sen.j: それ以降、洒落本からは手を切り、読本などに転じた。
sen.e: After the punishment, he gave up Sharebon and was converted to Yomihon (a long fiction book featuring histories and kanzen choaku [rewarding good and punishing evil]).
After the punishment, he gave up Sharebon and was converted to Yomihon (a long fiction book featuring histories and kanzen choaku [rewarding good and punishing evil]).

sen.j: 晩年は『近世奇跡考』など風俗考証の著作も残した。
sen.e: In his later years, he wrote books on studies on manners and customs, including "Kinse Kiseki Ko" (studies on modern manners and customs).
In his later years, he wrote books on studies on manners and customs, including "Kinsei Kiseki Ko" (studies on modern manners and customs).
sen.cmt: 『近世奇跡考』→近世は「きんせい」と読みます。（http://edb.kulib.kyoto-u.ac.jp/exhibit/kichosearch/src/tani834.html）
sen.e: In his later years, he wrote books on studies on manners and customs, including "Kinsei Kiseki Ko" (studies on modern manners and customs).

sen.j: 二度結婚したが、いずれも吉原の遊女上がりだった。
sen.e: He married twice to both Yujo prostitutes from Yoshiwara (famous Yujo town).
He got married twice, both times to yujo (prostitutes) from Yoshiwara (famous yujo town).
sen.cmt: ここでは"to"を使っているので他動詞"marry"ではなく、"got married"に修正しました。「遊女」は"yujo prostitute"だと二重になるので、説明としてprostituteを（）でくくりました。
sen.e: He got married twice, both times to yujo (prostitutes) from Yoshiwara (famous yujo town).

sen.j: 従来の戯作者はほとんどが余技で書いており原稿料もほとんどなかったが、原稿料が支払われるようになったのは山東京伝に対してが最初であるともいう。
sen.e: It is said that traditional Gesaku writers were not given enough manuscript fees as Gesaku was regarded as a side work of a professional writer, but Kyoden SANTO became the first Gesaku writer to receive a decent amount of manuscript fees in those years.

It is said that traditional Gesaku writers were not given enough manuscript fees as Gesaku was regarded as a side work, but Kyoden SANTO became the first Gesaku writer to receive a decent amount of manuscript fees in those years.
sen.cmt: 「余技で書いており」→副業で書くのがprofessional writerとは限らないので、"professional writer"を削除しました。
sen.e: It is said that traditional Gesaku writers were not given enough manuscript fees as Gesaku was regarded as a side work, but Kyoden SANTO became the first Gesaku writer to receive a decent amount of manuscript fees in those years.
